intro: Halimocnemis ferganica, commonly known as the Fergana sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit with small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Halimocnemis ferganica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils.
